attributes.action: reconsider the recent proposed reduction in the number of beds in Secure Children's Homes throughout the UK by the Youth Justice Board
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Secure children’s homes provide an essential service to the community; they provide a safe environment for the more vulnerable remanded/sentenced 10 to 17 year olds. The reduction of the number secure children homes, in particular the Atkinson Unit in the southwest will mean children being placed further away from home. It could mean more vulnerable children going to larger secure training centres, which could place them at greater risk. The closure of the unit will mean that there will only be 3 welfare beds (Beds occupied by young people that put themselves at serious risk of harm) in the whole of the southwest.

rejection.details: Petition creator requested the withdrawal of this petition from the Number 10 web site.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
